ygData.subject: Building on 64-bit Alpha processor
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, does anyone have any news on compiling cantera on 64-bit machines? I m trying to do that on a 64-bit Alpha one (Red Hat Linux 7.0). First of all I

Hi everyone, 
does anyone have any news on compiling cantera on 64-bit machines? 
I'm trying to do that on a 64-bit Alpha one (Red Hat Linux 7.0). 
 
First of all I switched off all the python/matlab stuff and it seems 
to build quite correctly all the directory lib, but when it goes to 
build the binary cti2ctml, it gives an ld segmentation fault. 
(exactly the following error: "collect2: ld terminated with signal 
11 [Segmentation fault] /usr/bin/ld: bfd assertion fail 
elf64-alpha.c:3006"). 
 
But the worst thing is that, more generally, I don't succeed in 
creating any shared libraries with the even compiled libraries for 
the same error of the dynamic linker. 
 
Do you have any idea to fix this problem? 
Thank you all. Vincenzo.
